intro: Cordylocarpus ramosissimus, commonly known as the silver fern, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-green leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The silver fern is not only ornamental but also holds cultural significance in Māori traditions.
